Midas Documentation » SECTION 5: Run Control » Run Control Programs » mhttpd: the MIDAS Web-based Run Control utility » Main Status Page

Redesign of mhttpd Main Status Page


The appearance of the Main Status Page has been changed (in versions after to Dec 2009) .

  • the "Analyzed" column has been dropped
  • the "FE Node" column is now labelled "Status" and may show equipment status information
  • the user-defined alias, script and "custom" hyperlinks now appear as buttons

  • there are now four different background colors (Jan 2010) for the four rows of buttons, i.e. :

    • Main menu buttons,
    • Script buttons,
    • Manually triggered events,
    • Alias & Custom page buttons.

    This change has been made because the original alias hyperlinks were hard to read if they included spaces. It also gives a more homogeneous look to the page. A status page of the new format is shown here.


New format Status page showing four rows of buttons





Prior to Dec 2009 the Custom Page and Alias hyperlinks appeared as links rather than buttons, as shown below:


Older version of mhttpd main Status page showing Custom Page and Alias Links
